column2: Statement

LMEC skin-in-the-game, revised upwards in November 2015 following increase in regulatory capital requirement. Consistent between Dec 2015, Mar 2016, Jun 2016 & Sept 2016. Increase of $200K in Dec-16 and unchanged for Mar-17, Jun-17 and Sep-17

Hypothetical capital (KCCP) [Art. 50c(1)(a), Regulation (EU) 648/2012], as of 30 Sep 17 based on the final SA-CCR methodology

Outright purchase + reverse repo. Repo pre and post haircuts consistent with 6.2, whereby the held post-haircut value will be greater than the amount received by the CCP, whilst conversely non-cash pre and post haircut values will be less. Weighted DF haircut = 3.540% for both Base and precious
Equal to 4.3.3

32 risk factor breaches and 2 margin portfolio breaches. Number of days (so number of reported breaches) is 13. Note this is the same total as in Q2 17 as there were no further breaches in Q3 17.

Methodology changed to summing up the investment value of all member margin held across both services and pre and post haircut. Previously this value was set to the IM requirement as per 6.1.1

9:45PM (EOD)

Methodology changed from factor backtesting to portfolio backtesting following review and changed for Q1 2017. The number of observations is calculated as the total number of portfolios multiplied by the total number of days in the lookback
Achieved coverage level measured as the total number of breaches across all portfolios in the lookback period

1) Final Cash payment of Variation Margin to CCP. Calculated VM (CVM which can be used to offset IM) is not included in this calculation. Cashflows are converted to USD equivalent, summed to account level and taking negative net amounts (payments to CCP)
2) Note the calculation for LMEprecious is done at the account level, for instance there is no netting of payments across house.

Significant intraday and end-of-day liquidity buffer, alongside limits on excess withdrawal, allow LMEC to release payments simultaneously without the need for prioritisation

For the purpose of liquidity modelling and determining available liquid financial resources, LMEC does not assume any collateral is available for liquidation,  the following are therefore excluded:
-The liquidation of any reverse repo investment collateral with counterparts included in the cover 2 ($1.57bn as at 29/9/2017 in 5 day stress, $1.724bn in 1 day cover 2 stress)
-term reverse repo (with investment counterparts outside of cover 2), ($1.15bn as at 29/9/2017 in 5 day stress and $1.75bn 1 day stress). Per LMEC Liquidity modelling, reverse repo will be considered as a liquid financial resource on the day of maturity;
-The liquidation of non-cash margin collateral from members included in the cover 2 ($367.82mn as at 29/9/2017 for the 5 day test and $0 for the 1 day test)

Limits per counterparty defined across 4 internal credit rating bands, based on concentration limits (as a percentage of total portfolio size). Max concentration limit range from 25% for AA- to AAA (CB1 & 2), to 15% for A- (CB4) and to 20% for A to A+ (CB3). BBB+ by exception with internal Risk Committee approval.
